en: Bless Jehovah, O my soul. O Jehovah my God, thou art very great; Thou art clothed with honor and majesty:
hmr: Aw ka hringna, LALPA chu inpâk rawh, Aw LALPA ka Pathien, nang chu i ropui êm êm a, Chawimawina le ropuinain în thuom a.

en: Who coverest thyself with light as with a garment; Who stretchest out the heavens like a curtain;
hmr: Nang chun var chu puon angin în bel a, Vânhai khi puon in chung angin i kei phar a.

en: Who layeth the beams of his chambers in the waters; Who maketh the clouds his chariot; Who walketh upon the wings of the wind;
hmr: Nang chun i pindan chunghnung kalkhanghai chu tuiahai khin i khang a, Sûmhai khi i tawlailîrah i siem a; Thli thla chungahai chun i lêng a.

en: Who maketh winds his messengers; Flames of fire his ministers;
hmr: Thlihai chu i vântirkohai în changtir a, Meichawk dur dur hai chu i rawngbâwltuahai în changtir hlak.

en: Who laid the foundations of the earth, That it should not be moved for ever.
hmr: Leihnuoi innghatsanhai chu i phûm a, Kumkhawtluonga ân hnîng nawna dingin.

en: Thou coveredst it with the deep as with a vesture; The waters stood above the mountains.
hmr: Nang chun leihnuoi hi tui inthûktak chu puon angin în siltir a, Tuihai chu tlânghai chunga chun an um puou a.

en: At thy rebuke they fled; At the voice of thy thunder they hasted away
hmr: I kâwkna lei chun an tlân- hmang a, I vâninrûm ri lei chun an fe hmang ta vak a.

en: (The mountains rose, the valleys sank down) Unto the place which thou hadst founded for them.
hmr: Tlângahai an hung ngîr suok a, Ruomahai an ṭum thlah a, An ta dinga hmun i buotsaina tieng chun.

en: Thou hast set a bound that they may not pass over; That they turn not again to cover the earth.
hmr: An khêl naw dingin ri i khang a, Hnuoi chîm tlum dinga an lêt nâwk ta nawna dingin.

en: He sendeth forth springs into the valleys; They run among the mountains;
hmr: Nang chun vadung ruomhaia dâm chun tuihnârhai i tir suok a, Tlânghai kâra chun an luong a.

en: They give drink to every beast of the field; The wild asses quench their thirst.
hmr: Chuonghai chun ram sa tinrênghai kuomah dâwn ding an pêk hlak a, Ram sabengtunghai chun an dangchâr an sukbo hlak.

en: By them the birds of the heavens have their habitation; They sing among the branches.
hmr: A kamhaia chun chunglêng va- têhaiin umna an nei hlak a, Thing buk laia chun an inhrâm hlak.

en: He watereth the mountains from his chambers: The earth is filled with the fruit of thy works.
hmr: Ama chun a pindan chunghnunga inthawk khin tlânghai chu tuiin a châwm hlak a, Hnuoi hi i thilthaw rahaiin a khawp hlak.

en: He causeth the grass to grow for the cattle, And herb for the service of man; That he may bring forth food out of the earth,
hmr: Hlobet chu ranhai ta dingin ân mâwngtir a, Thlai chu mihriem hmang dingin ân mâwngtir bawk a, Hnuoia inthawk fâk ding ân suoktir theina dingin.

en: And wine that maketh glad the heart of man, And oil to make his face to shine, And bread that strengtheneth man’s heart.
hmr: Mihriem lungril suklâwmna uoin leh, A hmai suktlawrna ding hriek leh, Mihriem lungril sukhrâtna bei leh.

en: The trees of Jehovah are filled with moisture, The cedars of Lebanon, which he hath planted;
hmr: LALPA thinghai chu an khawp hlak, Lebanon tlânga sidar thing a iphunhai chu.

en: Where the birds make their nests: As for the stork, the fir-trees are her house.
hmr: Chutaka chun vatêhai chun bu an sep hlak a, Vakâwl ruok chu fâr thing chu a in a nih.

en: The high mountains are for the wild goats; The rocks are a refuge for the conies.
hmr: Tlâng insânghai chu sakêl ta ding a na, Lungpuihai chu mazupui ta dinga inhumhimna a nih.

en: He appointed the moon for seasons: The sun knoweth his going down.
hmr: Ama chun thla khi hunbi hrietna dingin a ruot a, Nisa khin a tlâk pha chu a hriet hlak.

en: Thou makest darkness, and it is night, Wherein all the beasts of the forest creep forth.
hmr: Nang chun inthim i siem a, zân a hung na, Chu huna chun ramhnuoia sa tinrênghai chu an tla suok hlak.

en: The young lions roar after their prey, And seek their food from God.
hmr: Sakeibaknei vânglaihai chun an sa se ding chu inrûmkhumin, Pathien kuoma inthawka an fâk ding an zawng hlak.

en: The sun ariseth, they get them away, And lay them down in their dens.
hmr: Nisa a suok a, an fe hmang a, An umna pûk senga chun an zâl hlak.

en: Man goeth forth unto his work And to his labor until the evening.
hmr: Mihriem chu sinthaw dingin a suok a, Zântieng chenin inrimtakin a thaw hlak.

en: O Jehovah, how manifold are thy works! In wisdom hast thou made them all: The earth is full of thy riches.
hmr: Aw LALPA, i thilthawhai chu a va tam de! Varnain i siem vawng a nih: Leihnuoi hi i hausaknain a sip a ni hi.

en: Yonder is the sea, great and wide, Wherein are things creeping innumerable, Both small and great beasts.
hmr: Sawtaka sawn tuisuoriet a um a, nasatak lientak el chu, Sawtaka sawn thilhring bawk- vâka lâwn tiem sêng lo an um a, Sa chîn le sa lienhai chu.

en: There go the ships; There is leviathan, whom thou hast formed to play therein.
hmr: Sawtaka sawn lawnglienhai an fe saw, Sawtaka sawn leviathan a um a, a sûnga inhnel dinga i siem chu.

en: These wait all for thee, That thou mayest give them their food in due season.
hmr: Chuong po po chun an nghâk seng che a nih, A hun taka an bu i pêk seng hlakna dingin.

en: Thou givest unto them, they gather; Thou openest thy hand, they are satisfied with good.
hmr: An kuoma i pêk taphawt an rût hlak a, I kut i phar a, ṭhatnain an khawp hlak.

en: Thou hidest thy face, they are troubled; Thou takest away their breath, they die, And return to their dust.
hmr: I hmai i thup a, an lunginzîng hlak a, An thuok chu i lâkpêk a, an thih a, An pilvuta chun an kîr nâwk hlak.

en: Thou sendest forth thy Spirit, they are created; And thou renewest the face of the ground.
hmr: I thlarau chu i tir suok a, siemin an um hlak; Hnuoi chung khawm hi i siem thar nâwk hlak.

en: Let the glory of Jehovah endure for ever; Let Jehovah rejoice in his works:
hmr: LALPA ropuina chu kumkhaw- tluongin um sienla, LALPA chu a thilthawahai chun hlim raw se.

en: Who looketh on the earth, and it trembleth; He toucheth the mountains, and they smoke.
hmr: Ama chun hnuoi hi a en a, ân thin hlak a, Tlânghai chu a them a, a khu suok hlak.

en: I will sing unto Jehovah as long as I live: I will sing praise to my God while I have any being.
hmr: Ka dam sûng po chu LALPA chawimawiin hla sak ka ta, Ka hring sûng po chu ka Pathien chu inpâkin hla sak ka tih.

en: Let my meditation be sweet unto him: I will rejoice in Jehovah.
hmr: Ka ngaituona hi ama ta dingin thlumtak ni raw se, Kei chu LALPAA chun hlim ka tih.

en: Let sinners be consumed out of the earth. And let the wicked be no more. Bless Jehovah, O my soul. Praise ye Jehovah.
hmr: Mi suolhai chu hnuoia inthawk hin sukbohmangin um hai sienla, Mi rilohai chu um ta naw raw hai se! Aw ka hringna, LALPA chu inpâk rawh! LALPA chu inpâk ro!
